title: Fix missing tiger decorations and non-playing soundtrack

requirements.text: Ensure the tiger decal decorations referenced by the hero section render reliably in the UI. Specifically, the two hero-section images in `frontend/src/App.tsx` must load from `/assets/generated/tiger-decal-left.dim_256x256.png` and `/assets/generated/tiger-decal-right.dim_256x256.png` and be visibly present on the initial (non-results) screen.
acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh load (before results are shown), the hero section displays two subtle tiger decal images (one top-left, one bottom-right).
The decals load from the exact public paths `/assets/generated/tiger-decal-left.dim_256x256.png` and `/assets/generated/tiger-decal-right.dim_256x256.png` without showing broken-image UI.
If an asset is missing or fails to load, the UI hides the broken image element (no broken-image icon/box is shown).

requirements.text: Add/verify the required static tiger decal image assets exist in the frontend public assets path so the hero section can load them. Place them under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using the exact filenames already referenced by the app.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/assets/generated/tiger-decal-left.dim_256x256.png` exists and is served by the frontend.
`frontend/public/assets/generated/tiger-decal-right.dim_256x256.png` exists and is served by the frontend.

requirements.text: Fix the soundtrack play behavior so that pressing the Play control produces audible audio (when not muted) and does not fail silently. The soundtrack must be loaded from the existing path referenced in `frontend/src/components/SoundtrackControls.tsx`: `/assets/audio/barrera-healthy-eats-theme.mp3`.

quotes: …and there’s no soundtrack when you press play

acceptanceCriteria: When the user clicks the Play button in the header, background music becomes audible within 1 second (assuming the browser/audio is allowed and volume is not muted).
The Play/Pause icon correctly reflects playback state (Play when stopped, Pause when playing).
If playback fails (e.g., browser blocks it or the file is missing), the app shows a clear English, user-facing message indicating audio could not be played (and does not only log to the console).
The audio file is served from `/assets/audio/barrera-healthy-eats-theme.mp3` (frontend static asset), and the Play button uses that file.

requirements.text: Ensure the soundtrack audio asset exists in the frontend public assets path at the exact URL used by the app: `/assets/audio/barrera-healthy-eats-theme.mp3`.

quotes: …and there’s no soundtrack when you press play

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/assets/audio/barrera-healthy-eats-theme.mp3` exists and is served by the frontend at runtime.
Clicking Play does not produce a 404 for `/assets/audio/barrera-healthy-eats-theme.mp3` in the browser network panel.

constraints: Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for these UI/static-asset issues.
Do not modify files in `frontend/src/components/ui` or other `frontend.immutablePaths`; compose existing UI components instead.
Serve tiger decals and audio as frontend static assets (do not serve images/audio from the backend).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Changing the recommendation logic, recipe data, or results rendering.
Adding new soundtrack tracks, playlists, or streaming integrations.
Redesigning the overall app theme beyond what is necessary to make the decals and soundtrack function reliably.

required: Tiger decal illustration, left corner variant (tiger-decal-left.dim_256x256.png)
Tiger decal illustration, right corner variant (tiger-decal-right.dim_256x256.png)
